item.title: Changing starting stats items and items in p16 v.6 edit 7
item.dc:creator: @Y0_J0k3r Y0_J0k3r
item.description:
@Y0_J0k3r wrote:

When i changed the hp to 99 when started i get errors saying

client.java:11380: 'class' or 'interface' expected return true; ^ client.java:11381: 'class' or 'interface' expected } ^ client.java:30261: 'class' or 'interface' expected

^
3 errors

This is the code i added…

for (int i=0; i<playerItems.length; i++) if (i == 3) { playerLevel[i] = 99; playerXP[i] = 14000000; } else { playerLevel[i] = 1; playerXP[i] = 0; } return false; }

item.title: Changing starting stats items and items in p16 v.6 edit 7
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

Purpose: to make it so you start out with skills and items

Difficulty: 2

Assumed Knowledge: know how to change things to what you like or copy and paste

Server Base: ahimscape (project 16 v.6 modified)

Classes Modified: Player.java

credits to me

step 1 go into player.java and search for this

		for (int i=0; i<playerLevel.length; i++) { //Setting Levels[/code]

you will see something like this

[code]			if (i == 3) {
				playerLevel[i] = 10;
				playerXP[i] = 1100;
			} else {
				playerLevel[i] = 1;
				playerXP[i] = 0;
			}
		}[/code]

[b]step 2[/b]

now change the 10 to whatever lvl you want to start at then the 1100 to the exp at that lvl. this is for hp but to add more you can change it so it looks like this

[code]			if (i == 3 || i == 2) {
				playerLevel[i] = 10;
				playerXP[i] = 1100;
			} else {
				playerLevel[i] = 1;
				playerXP[i] = 0;
			}
		}[/code]

now all i added in there was this [code] || i == 2[/code] the 2 stands for the skill number so that is str 3 is hp i think. to add more just do the same thing do [code] || i == #[/code] then change the # to the skill number you want to be higher when you start.


[b]to make you start with items[/b]

[b]Step 3[/b]

first go into player.java and search for this

[code]		//Giving the player an unique look[/code]

then you will see this 

[code]		//Giving the player an unique look
		//playerEquipment[playerHat]=Item.randomHat();
		//playerEquipment[playerCape]=Item.randomCape();
		//playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=Item.randomAmulet();
		//playerEquipment[playerChest]=Item.randomBody();
		//playerEquipment[playerShield]=Item.randomShield();
		//playerEquipment[playerLegs]=Item.randomLegs();
		//playerEquipment[playerHands]=Item.randomGloves();
		//playerEquipment[playerFeet]=Item.randomBoots();
		//playerEquipment[playerRing]=Item.randomRing();
		//playerEquipment[playerArrows]=Item.randomArrows();
		//playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=4151;[/code]

[b]step 4[/b]

ok so take out the // and you will start with complete random stuff except for weapon which is a whip. now to make it so you can start with what you choose take out the [code].random[/code] parts and replace them with the item id you want them to start with. so if you wanted the amulet to start with fury ammy you would make it look like this...

[code]		//Giving the player an unique look
		//playerEquipment[playerHat]=Item.randomHat();
		//playerEquipment[playerCape]=Item.randomCape();
		playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=6585;
		//playerEquipment[playerChest]=Item.randomBody();
		//playerEquipment[playerShield]=Item.randomShield();
		//playerEquipment[playerLegs]=Item.randomLegs();
		//playerEquipment[playerHands]=Item.randomGloves();
		//playerEquipment[playerFeet]=Item.randomBoots();
		//playerEquipment[playerRing]=Item.randomRing();
		//playerEquipment[playerArrows]=Item.randomArrows();
		playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=4151;

notice how i changed the .randomAmulet; to playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=6585; and thats how you do all that stuff hope this helps

credits to me

Read full topic
